title: Hiker rescued 6,200 feet up mountain after 6-foot boulder rolled onto him
description: A hiker was seriously injured on Sunday when a large boulder rolled onto him as he descended down a mountain in Washington, according to rescue teams.

title: Covid-19 relief fund allocation may shortchange Black communities, new research suggests
description: The formula for how Covid-19 relief funding from the federal government gets allocated to hospitals across the United States could have a "disparate impact" on hospitals in counties with a higher-than-average share of Black residents, new research suggests.

title: Trump postpones G7 summit again
description: President Donald Trump said Monday that he will look to postpone the G7 meeting until after the election in November, after a previous delay due to Covid concerns.

title: 'Yo Semite' t-shirts are a big hit for one Jewish museum following President Trump's blunder
description: Boosted by President Trump's blooper mispronouncing the name of Yosemite National Park, the National Museum of American Jewish History has seen sales for a t-shirt with the saying "Yo Semite" skyrocket.

title: 'Spa' raids in resort towns spark outrage over Mexico's human trafficking problem
description: It was an unusual scene, especially for two Mexican cities known more for beaches and tourism.

title: Yes, of course Donald Trump wants his face added to Mount Rushmore
description: On Sunday night, President Donald Trump tweeted out a picture of himself standing in front of Mount Rushmore -- an image that made him look as though he was the fifth presidential bust on the iconic monument.

title: Will Richard Branson ever be Richard Branson again?
description: Richard Branson loves a challenge. The Virgin Group founder has built a reputation, and his more than $4 billion fortune, on the back of his willingness to take bold risks and venture into new areas of business.

title: Perseid meteor shower: How and when to watch
description: The Perseid meteor shower, one of the most popular meteor showers of the year, will face some competition from the moon this year during its peak.

title: This school reopened and one child infected 25 teachers
description: During the first few months of the pandemic, Israel was praised for its response to the coronavirus but after the country reopened its schools, it has seen a surge in outbreaks. CNN's Elliott Gotkine reports.

title: 'Speaking and eating' likely to be a 'challenge in the coming period' for cyclist after horrific crash
description: Fabio Jakobsen, the Dutch cyclist who sustained serious facial injuries in a horrifying crash last week in Poland, is expected to make a comeback to cycling, his team doctor said.

title: Antonio Banderas tests positive for coronavirus
description: Antonio Banderas says he has tested positive for coronavirus.

title: McDonald's is suing its ousted CEO for lying about sexual relationships with employees
description: Ousted McDonald's CEO Steve Easterbrook lied to the board about the extent of his relationships with employees, the company alleged in a new lawsuit. He misled investigators about engaging in physical sexual relationships with three employees in the year before his ouster, according to the documents.

title: Golf's 'new Tiger Woods' makes history
description: As the PGA Championship entered its final day on Sunday and, at one point, six players shared the lead, all attention was on the usual suspects: Brooks Koepka, Dustin Johnson, Justin Rose.

title: Moderna's clinical trial numbers show there's 'no way' Trump can have a vaccine by Election Day
description: Contrary to his predictions, President Trump won't have a coronavirus vaccine ready by Election Day, vaccine experts tell CNN after reviewing data from Moderna, the first company to begin its Phase 3 clinical trials of a coronavirus vaccine in the United States.

title: Teen who shared photo of packed high school hallway says she's receiving threats
description: A teen who shared a photo of a crowded hallway at her Georgia high school last week says she has been receiving threats after the image went viral.

title: Australia's oldest micronation, Hutt River is no more thanks to Covid-19
description: The 50-year reign of an Australia-based micronation formed by a "prince" has come to an end.

title: A record number of people are giving up their US citizenship, according to new research. Here's why
description: A record number of people are giving up their US citizenship, new research published on Sunday found.

title: This is what it's like for family of the missing in Beirut
description: Michelle hasn't slept for three nights. Her husband Joe worked at the Beirut port but she hasn't heard from him since the blast. CNN's Arwa Damon meets Michelle, her two small daughters and a family fearing the worst.

title: How New Zealand went 100 days with no community Covid-19 transmission
description: New Zealand has marked an enviable milestone -- more than 100 days since its last coronavirus case was acquired locally from an unknown source.

title: Monsoon rains trigger tea plantation landslide killing at least 43
description: At least 43 people, including three children, have died with dozens more feared buried after torrential rains triggered a landslide in the southwestern Indian state of Kerala.

title: Europe's biggest countries are seeing Covid surges -- but not this one
description: A horrifying moment in the Covid-19 pandemic hit Italy on March 27, 2020, when the civil protection authorities announced that 969 people had died in just 24 hours. In the weeks before that, images of coffins stacked up in church parlors and being driven down the streets of the northern Italian town of Bergamo in a caravan of military trucks poured into the homes of Italians, by then locked down for nearly three weeks.

title: Trump's big power move leaves workers in limbo
description:
• Analysis: The final Biden VP rankings
• Opinion: Biden just destroyed one of Trump's biggest attack lines

title: Esper appears to backtrack on Beirut explosion cause after White House pushback
description: Defense Secretary Mark Esper is downplaying any differences he had with the White House's assessment as to what caused the deadly explosion in Beirut after his speculation that the blast was likely the result of an accident drew push back from the White House.

title: Afghanistan to release 400 Taliban prisoners, paving way for direct peace talks
description: The Afghan government has agreed to release 400 Taliban prisoners, paving the way for direct peace talks with the insurgent group to end nearly two decades of war.

title: Hong Kong pro-democracy media tycoon arrested under new national security law
description: A Hong Kong media tycoon known for his support of the city's pro-democracy movement and criticism of China has been arrested under the new security law imposed on the city last month, which bans "collusion with foreign forces."

title: Former WWE wrestler James 'Kamala' Harris dies at 70
description: Former WWE wrestler James Harris has died at age 70, according to a news release from the wrestling company.

title: Top US health official meets with Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen in highest-level summit for decades
description: Alex Azar, the United States Health and Human Services secretary, met with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen Monday, the highest-level meeting between Washington and the self-ruled island in decades.

title: Collin Morikawa wins the 2020 PGA Championship
description: Collin Morikawa won the 2020 PGA Championship Sunday with a come-from-behind victory.

title: Protests in Belarus as disputed early election results give President overwhelming victory
description: Protests erupted across Belarus late Sunday after disputed preliminary results showed a landslide election victory for longtime President Alexander Lukashenko.

title: These are the twins whose first-time reaction to hearing Phil Collins has captured the internet
description: The almost eight-minute long video begins with Tim Williams and his twin brother, Fred, sitting side by side.

title: Trump says he's open to allowing unemployed to get enhanced benefits without states paying part of the cost
description: President Donald Trump opened the door on Sunday to allowing some unemployed Americans to get enhanced unemployment benefits even if the states in which they live won't pay part of the costs.

title: Democratic women leaders call out sexist news coverage of female vice presidential candidates
description: A group of Democratic women leaders is calling out sexist coverage of female Democratic vice presidential contenders  — and they're asking that newsrooms to do better.

title: Joe Biden just destroyed one of Trump's biggest attack lines
description: Joe Biden on Saturday utterly devastated one of President Donald Trump's most repeated attack lines against the former Vice President. And the irony is Fox News helped him do it.
